name: Ben Sasse
summary: Former Republican Senator and university president who voted to convict Trump in his second impeachment and called Trump's conspiracy theories 'reckless attacks on the foundation of our constitutional Republic.'

keyStatements.quote: The president and his allies are playing with fire. They have been asking – first the courts, then state legislatures, now the Congress – to overturn the results of a presidential election. They have unsuccessfully called on judges and are now calling on federal officeholders to invalidate millions and millions of votes. If you make big claims, you had better have the evidence. But the president doesn't and neither do the institutional arsonist members of Congress who will object to the Electoral College vote.
The President of the United States summoned this mob, assembled the mob, and lit the flame of this attack.
Adults don't point a loaded gun at the heart of legitimate self-government.
